intro: Licania hylaea, commonly known as the red-stemmed licania, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Licania hylaea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and marshes. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
